description: Master CIMA P3 covering Enterprise Risk, Internal Controls, and Risk Response

slides.title: Welcome to CIMA P3
slides.content:
# P3 - Risk Management

P3 covers **enterprise risk** and **internal controls**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Risk** - ERM framework
- **Controls** - Internal control
- **Audit** - Internal audit
- **Ethics** - Governance

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Risk management | 35% |
| Internal controls | 30% |
| Internal audit | 20% |
| Ethics | 15% |

slides.title: Enterprise Risk Management
slides.content:
# ERM Framework

## COSO ERM Components

| Component | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Governance | Culture, oversight |
| Strategy | Objectives |
| Performance | Risk identification |
| Review | Assessment |
| Information | Communication |

## Risk Categories

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Strategic | Competition |
| Operational | Process |
| Financial | Market |
| Compliance | Regulatory |

slides.title: Risk Assessment
slides.content:
# Identifying Risk

## Techniques

| Technique | Approach |
|-----------|----------|
| Brainstorming | Group |
| Interviews | Expert |
| Workshops | Facilitated |
| Checklists | Standard |
| SWOT | Analysis |

## Risk Matrix

| | Low Impact | High Impact |
|---|------------|-------------|
| High Probability | Medium | High |
| Low Probability | Low | Medium |

## Risk Appetite

```
Level of risk willing to accept
in pursuit of objectives
```

slides.title: Risk Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Risk appetite is the level of risk an organization is?

slides.title: Risk Response
slides.content:
# Managing Risk

## Response Strategies

| Strategy | Action |
|----------|--------|
| Avoid | Eliminate |
| Reduce | Controls |
| Transfer | Insurance |
| Accept | Tolerate |
| Exploit | Opportunity |

## Residual Risk

```
Inherent Risk - Control Effectiveness
= Residual Risk

Must be within tolerance
```

## Cost-Benefit

```
Control cost vs Risk reduction
```

slides.title: Financial Risks
slides.content:
# Market Risks

## Types

| Risk | Source |
|------|--------|
| Currency | Exchange rates |
| Interest | Rate changes |
| Commodity | Price volatility |
| Equity | Market movements |

## Hedging

| Instrument | Use |
|------------|-----|
| Forwards | Lock rate |
| Futures | Exchange-traded |
| Options | Right, not obligation |
| Swaps | Exchange payments |

## Five Components

slides.quizQuestion: COSO internal control has how many components?

slides.title: Control Activities
slides.content:
# Types of Controls

## By Timing

| Type | When |
|------|------|
| Preventive | Before |
| Detective | After |
| Corrective | Remedy |

## By Nature

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Authorization | Approval |
| Segregation | Separate duties |
| Physical | Security |
| Reconciliation | Matching |

## IT Controls

- General (access, change)
- Application (input, processing, output)

slides.title: Internal Audit
slides.content:
# Audit Function

## Definition

```
Independent, objective assurance
and consulting activity
```

## IIA Standards

| Category | Focus |
|----------|-------|
| Attribute | Quality |
| Performance | Work |

## Reporting

- To audit committee
- Independence essential
- Risk-based approach

slides.title: Audit Planning
slides.content:
# Risk-Based Audit

## Annual Plan

| Factor | Consideration |
|--------|---------------|
| Risk | Priority |
| Resources | Capacity |
| Coverage | Rotation |
| Requests | Management |

## Engagement

```
1. Objectives
2. Scope
3. Timing
4. Resources
5. Communication
```

## Methodology

- Risk focus
- Controls testing
- Substantive testing
